column4: How to fix package install error: libglu1-mesa-dev: Depends: libglu1-mesa (= 7.4-0ubuntu3.1) but 7.4-0ubuntu3.2 is to be installed.
what were you trying to install?
libglu1-mesa-dev
what were you trying to install, that depended on it.
I was trying to install libglu1-mesa-dev, it depended on libglu1-mesa
ok, why were you trying to libglu1-mesa-dev
To compile a game on linux
and the truth shall set you free.
what game, and are you sure its not in the repos?
Trying to compile Egoboo, but the repo version is outdated so I have to compile the latest one.
how did you install the dependencies?
My guess was that the dependencies were installed when I installed my IDE, code::blocks
link me to where you downloaded the source
http://sourceforge.net/projects/egoboo/files/Linux%20Source%20Distro/2.7.4%20%28Stable%2032-bit%29/egoboo-2.7.4.tar.gz/download
Basically, it says I have 7.4-0ubuntu3.2 installed, but libglu1-mesa-dev needs 7.4-0ubuntu3.1
ok, hang on a sec, its downloading
haven't forgotten you, these dependencies are taking a while to install
Lol thanks :P I'm currently downgrading my libglu1-mesa to see if that would fix the problem.
Hey! I think I solved my problem. I just downgraded the package and everything worked out fine! Whats funny is that I had a version installed that wasn't on the ubuntu repos. Odd...
ok.. did you try running apt-get build-dep?
Nope, whats that do?
when you're downloading the source for a program, and there's an older version in the repositories
Ah I see. Thanks!
